text: in this video you'll see how you can
visualize third-party data with amazon
quicksite
with this cloud-powered business
analytics service you can leverage a
full-featured bi platform quickly assess
exported data and publish and share
dashboards with key stakeholders
amazon quicksite enables users of all
skill levels to get business insights by
building visualizations and performing
ad hoc analysis at any time on any
device
before getting started let's look at an
overview of the tasks we'll complete in
this demonstration
the tasks are described in the aws data
exchange workshop titled visualize data
with amazon quick site a link to this
page can be found in the description for
this video
first we'll set up amazon quick site
then we'll load data into quicksite from
an amazon simple storage service or
amazon s3 bucket
finally we'll visualize the data by
creating a dashboard
next let's look at the prerequisites
for demonstration purposes we've already
subscribed to the sample data set and
exported the data into an s3 bucket
we also need to ensure we have
administrator access let's do that now
from the aws management console we'll
navigate to identity and access
management or iam
we can see that we've been assigned to
the admins user group let's view the
group permissions
the administrator access policy is
attached providing us with the
permissions we need
note that policies can be attached to
specific users as well
if we didn't already have the
appropriate permissions we could search
for the policy we need
let's return to the aws management
console
now that we've confirmed that the
prerequisites are complete let's return
to the workshop to review the next steps
to set up amazon quicksite we'll first
need to sign up for the service and then
we'll need to grant it access to our s3
buckets let's begin by navigating to
quicksite
if an account is already set up with
quicksite the homepage will appear here
in this case we haven't signed up yet
let's do that now
quicksite offers standard and enterprise
editions
in this case we just need a standard
account
let's scroll down and provide a name and
email address for the account
next we'll give quicksite access to our
amazon s3 buckets
now we'll select finish to create our
account
we're now signed up for amazon quicksite
let's go there now
on the analyses page several sample
analyses are already populated
there are also some test data sets
we can manage our quick site settings
let's navigate to security and
permissions
we can grant quicksite access to aws
services from here
we already granted quicksite access to
our s3 buckets so we'll return to the
analyses page
now let's create a new data set
we can create our data set from various
types of data sources let's quickly look
at how to upload a local file
we can see a preview of the data set the
data set and file look good so we'll
select next
we can select visualize to finish
importing the data in this case we'll
close the window so we can look at how
to import data from s3
enter a name for the data source and
then enter the url of our json manifest
file
in the url we need to include the name
of the s3 bucket we exported our data
set to to get the name let's navigate to
the aws management console
next let's open s3
here we can see the data set that we
imported into the bucket previously
next let's take a look at the manifest
file
here we can see information about the
file including the name of the bucket
where it's located
now let's add the name to the bucket url
and connect to the data source
we can see the estimated table size and
how much storage space is available
now let's visualize this data set
as the data is being imported we can
monitor the progress in the upper right
corner of the screen
the import is complete and we can now
use the data to create a dashboard
in the visualize panel we can see the
data fields that are in this data set
we'll select the ticker and esg fields
to populate the dashboard
a visualization is created automatically
without requiring us to write any code
or complete any complex configuration
now let's publish the dashboard
we'll name the dashboard esg by ticker
now let's share the dashboard with our
team members
we can invite specific users and groups
to access the dashboard in this case
we'll enable access for everyone in this
account
we can also copy the link so that people
can access the dashboard directly
just like that we imported a data set
from s3 into quicksite to quickly create
a dashboard that we can share with key
stakeholders
you've just seen how you can visualize
third-party data with amazon quicksite
you can learn more about this topic in
the description and links for this video
thanks for watching now it's your turn
to try
